definition: A series of statements which returns some value to a caller. It can also be passed zero or more arguments which may be used in the execution of the body. See also parameter, method, and the Function definitions section.
A named entity in a function (or method) definition that specifies an argument (or in some cases, arguments) that the function can accept.
Variables are nothing but reserved memory locations to store values. This means that when you create a variable you reserve some space in memory.
A value passed to a function (or method) when calling the function. There are two types of arguments.
An associative array, where arbitrary keys are mapped to values. The keys can be any object with __hash__() and __eq__() methods. Called a hash in Perl.

A tuple is a sequence of immutable Python objects. Tuples are sequences, just like lists. The differences between tuples and lists are, the tuples cannot be changed unlike lists and tuples use parentheses, whereas lists use square brackets.

ASCII stands for American Standard Code for Information Interchange. Computers can only understand numbers, so an ASCII code is the numerical representation of a character such as 'a' or '@' or an action of some sort.
A module is a file containing Python definitions and statements.
A built-in Python sequence. Despite its name it is more akin to an array in other languages than to a linked list since access to elements are O(1).
Strings are amongst the most popular types in Python. We can create them simply by enclosing characters in quotes.
It has the ability to iterate over the items of any sequence, such as a list or a string.
They are often called just integers or ints, are positive or negative whole numbers with no decimal point.
They represent real numbers and are written with a decimal point dividing the integer and fractional parts.

In Python, there are two ways to annotate your code. The first is to include comments that detail or indicatewhat a section of code – or snippet – does. The second makes use of multi-line comments or paragraphs that serve as documentation for others reading your code.
A template for creating user-defined objects. Class definitions normally contain method definitions which operate on instances of the class.
the so-called csv (comma separated values) format is the most common import and export format for spreadsheets and databases.
